text: Standard 1: VISUAL ART MEDIA, TECHNIQUES, AND PROCESSES

children.text: Students understand and apply visual art media, techniques, and processes.
Know differences between visual art media
Know the different techniques used to create visual art.
Know differences between visual art processes.
Know how different visual art materials, techniques, and processes cause different responses.
Know how different visual art media, techniques, and processes are used to communicate ideas, experience, and stories.
Use visual art materials and tools in a safe and responsible manner.
Understand differences between visual art media.
Understand how different techniques are used to create visual art.
Understand differences between visual art processes.
Understand how different visual art materials, techniques, and processes cause different responses.
Understand how different visual art media, techniques, and processes are used to communicate ideas, experience, and stories.
Use visual art materials and tools in a safe and responsible manner.
Use visual art media, techniques, and processes to accomplish a purpose in their own works of art.
Understand how to create works of art that communicate an idea in one or more art visual media.
Use visual art materials and tools in a safe and responsible manner.
Students understand how works of art are structured and how visual art has a variety of functions.
Know the differences among visual art structures and functions.
Know how expressive images cause different responses and communicate ideas.
Use visual art structures and functions of works of art to communicate ideas.
Know the effects of visual art structures and functions.
Understand and use visual art organizational structures and analyze what makes them effective or ineffective in the communication of ideas.
Understand how the characteristics and structures of visual art are used to accomplish personal, commercial, societal, or other visual art intentions.
Understand what makes various visual art organizational structures effective or ineffective in the communication of ideas.

text: Standard 3: SUBJECT MATTER, THEMES, SYMBOLS, AND IDEAS IN VISUAL ART

children.text: Students know a range of subject matter, themes, symbols, and ideas.
Understand how a variety of subjects, themes, symbols and ideas are incorporated in a selection of works of art.
Understand how to apply subjects, themes, symbols and ideas in visual art to communicate ideas.
Understand how to interpret, integrate, and apply subjects, symbols, themes and ideas in their work of art.

text: Standard 4: VISUAL ART HISTORY AND CULTURE

children.text: Students understand the visual arts in relation to history and culture.
Know that visual art has both a history and specific relationship to various cultures.
Understand the characteristics of works of art in various eras and cultures.
Understand works of art among a variety of historical and cultural contexts in terms of characteristics, functions, and purposes of visual art.
Understand relationships among works of art in terms of history, aesthetics, and culture.

text: Standard 5: MERITS OF WORKS OF VISUAL ART

children.text: Students understand the characteristics and merit of one's own work of art and the works of art of others.
Know various purposes for creating works of art.
Know that works of art can elicit different responses.
Understand multiple purposes for creating works of art.
Understand how one's own work of art may elicit a variety of responses.
Understand the possible intentions of those creating works of art.
Understand how specific works of art are created and how they relate to historical and cultural contexts.
Understand how one's own work of art has purpose and meaning.
Students make connections between the visual arts and other disciplines.
Know the similarities and differences between the visual arts and other arts disciplines (performing arts, literature, practical arts).
Know connections between the visual arts and other disciplines in the curriculum.
Understand the similarities between visual art and other arts disciplines (performing arts, literature, practical arts) that share similar themes, historical period, or cultural context.
Understand the relationship between the visual arts and other disciplines in the curriculum.
Understand and compare the similarities between visual arts and other art disciplines (performing arts, literature, practical arts) that share common themes, historical periods, and cultural context.
Understand the relationship between the visual arts and other disciplines in the curriculum.
